thread.title: Best Culture Restaurants in Pune For An Unmatched Culinary Experience (Saurav Mishra)
thread.title_full: Best Culture Restaurants in Pune For An Unmatched Culinary Experience (Saurav Mishra)

title: Best Culture Restaurants in Pune For An Unmatched Culinary Experience (Saurav Mishra)
text: Sep 30, 2015 Ban Tao, Hyatt Hotel, Kalyaninagar - For the best in Pan Asian cuisine, a visit to Baan Tao located in Hyatt Hotel is recommended. Your love for Thai and Chinese food will grow after you sample the fare here. Some of the best Thai chefs in the country rustle up an amazing spread. One should definitely order the crunchy papaya salad as well as the sweet tamarind-based fish. The ambience is perfect for a lunch or dinner date with mini waterfalls in the tea lounge. On Thursdays, the place is transformed in a street food festival serving Asian cuisine. You can take-away dim sums and the famous shabu shabu Japanese hot pots. For a great cultural dining experience, it is one of the best restaurants in Pune. Bounty, Kalyaninagar - If you are in the mood for Continental cuisine, especially sizzlers, then Bounty is just the restaurant for you. The combination of fish, beef and vegetables served hot on a platter with various sauces is a delight. This Parsi restaurant is famous among locals. The decor and service are decent. The restaurant serves a great version of beef sizzlers with steak and cordon bleu among their specialities. A few of their chicken dishes are also worth trying out. Malaka Spice, Koregaon Park - Malaka Spice is among the best eating hotspots in the city. Creativity and innovation are the guiding forces behind the dishes served. For example, the 'A Chef Cheeru Original' is a fusion dish which has been specially created for patrons by renowned Chef Cheeru. Another dish by the chef, 'Inspired not Imitated', is a traditional dish which has been given a modern twist. The restaurant also comes with a street food corner area which serves meat satay and vegetables. You can also find a wide spread of Indonesian, Thai, Vietnamese and Burmese fare on offer. It also serves as an art gallery, representing 200 artists. Sen5es, Mundhwa - A lot of expats visit this restaurant since it serves a variety of world cuisine in a plush, modern setting. Some of the dishes that you should definitely order include rustic tomato and basil soup, the caesar salad and the American T-bone steak. The ambience has a laidback yet classy feel to it. If you are in the mood for a drink, the restaurant serves close to 100 alcoholic beverages. It is among the top restaurants in Pune. Prego, Westin Hotel, Mundhwa - An authentic Italian restaurant serving wood-fired pizzas, lasagne, and pastas is any foodies dream place. Part of the Westin Hotel's line-up of eateries, the decor and service are refined. One should also try the desserts on offer. The next time you want to sample cuisine from different parts of the world, these top restaurants in Pune will give you what you are searching for. About the Author This article has been penned by Saurav Mishra and touches upon the Places to Shop in Pune . It highlights streets that provide the best deals and as well as high end stores. Rating:
